data.title: Character following "[]" in scene2d labels has wrong width
data.body: I wrote a [small reproduction class](https://gist.github.com/horse-mans/ebbb6739b2234460d07e) for this. Tested in libgdx 1.6.5 on OS X 10.10.5. The basic idea is that when using color markup in scene2d labels, the character immediately following the "pop color" control code, `[]`, either doesn't have its width set correctly, or is not offset the correct amount from the character before the control code. The problem isn't confined to fonts with fixed width glyphs specified, but it does help illustrate it better. The above code run with the call to `font.setFixedWidthGlyphs` commented out: Small but noticeable difference. This difference is more pronounced on monospace fonts (even with no fixed width glyphs specified). With the call uncommented: Note: 1. How more pronounced the effect is the more `[]` controls are in the string, and 2. The amount of space between the last 't' and the first period on each line. This may or may not be related to #3239, but my hunch is it's a different subtle bug somewhere else in the glyph width calculation :-)

data.title: uiskin in json format is wrong and should be in double qoutes
Field#getElementType differs under GWT
[Improvement] Allow to cache BoundingBox in Model, ModelInstance and Node
data.body:
I think adding cached boundingbox to Model, ModelInstance and Node would be great for performance improvement.
The cached boundingBox would be computed only on access [getBoundingBox](so if no access, no compute). And updated if mesh is updated or if modelinstance is moved.
It would increase performance for frustum culling or others.

What is your opinion about it ?

data.title: TextTooltip size calculation is wrong
data.body:
There is an issue with the calculation of `TextTooltip` size, although I'm not 100% sure of what it is.
- In the best case, calculation works, and you get a nice tooltip.
- In the worst case, you end up with a label that never finishes getting a correct size, and its text constantly shrinks and grows forever

I'm not sure of what the problem might be, although it might have to do with the width size calculation not taking into account pads for the label size?

data.title: AssetManager refcount issue
data.body:
Hi,

I found an issue in the AssetManager refCount management : https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/assets/AssetManager.java#L396

Here, if the asset is duplicated, the refcount should be incremented

I did not make a PR because I'm not 100% sure of my analysis, but I'm sure a Gdx master could confirm or not the issue here quickly.

Thanks.

data.title: Libgdx setup UI does not warn against invalid package names
data.body:
I had a project subpackage starting with a number, so now I have to rebuild the project.

It'd be nice if the setup UI warned that you've entered an invalid package name.

data.title: Scene2d TextField Added an optional constructor
data.body: Constructs a textfield with an empty string

data.title: Apostrophes in project name are not escaped in build.gradle
data.body:
When creating a new project and putting an apostrophe in the name, the project build.gradle is not escaped causing a gradle build error at appName, such as

```
appName = 'Devin's App'
```

Which should be escaped to

```
appName = 'Devin\'s App'
```

data.title: Stage keeps propagating handled touch events
data.body:
I just stumbled over this issue:
http://gamedev.stackexchange.com/questions/106120/stopping-actor-tap-click-event-from-propagating

I believe this might be a bug in `Stage`. Looking at its `touchUp` handler (or any of the other handlers), it doesn't appear to stop events from propagating when listeners handle it, since it makes no attempt to break out of the loop if `Event#isHandled()` is true:
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/2bd1557bc293cb8c2348374771aad832befbe26f/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/Stage.java#L348

This means that it's impossible to receive click events in actors and swallow them in order to prevent them from triggering other game behavior in response to taps on the stage.

data.title: Fix grays having wrong shades
data.body: Light gray was darker than regular gray.

data.title: box2d World: Ability to tune pool memory consumption
data.body:
The fixture and body pools are constructed using magic numbers of 100 initial entries and 200 max entries.
Clients should be able to configure these to tune their memory consumption as they see fit.

I have a fix for this.

data.title: World::destroyBody returns fixtures to pool
data.body:
Without this the freeFixtures pool is never actually used and new fixtures are always allocated.
When you have many bullets/projectiles/particles getting created/destroyed this causes a lot of GC churn.

Fixes #3364

NOTE: I am placing my code modification in this PR into the Public Domain.  It is small and I don't want to sign the CLA.

data.title: box2d World: Failure to use Pool generates Fixture garbage
data.body:
While a fixturePool exists in World.java, it isn't being used.  Namely, you obtain() objects from the fixturePool forever, and never free any of them after the parent body is destroyed.  While Body has a reset() method that purports to return the freed fixtures to the pool, it doesn't work correctly because 1) Body.reset isn't called until someone tries to reobtain the freed Body and 2) all the fixtures have been removed from the Body at that point, so an empty list of Fixtures is freed.

I have a fix for this.

data.title: Add PrefixFileHandleResolver
data.body: Add a simple `FileHandleResolver` that allows you to specify a sub-folder to use within the base.

data.title: v1.6.4: Gdx.input.isKeyPressed() for Keys.ALT_LEFT and Keys.ALT_RIGHT always true
data.body: It is as the title states, doing this check always returns true, even when another key is pressed. I don't know which version it crept in, because it was working properly before.

data.title: Gyroscope Implementation for android
data.body:
This works for me on android.  It’s a copy over of the accelerometer implementation… just wiring up another sensor for use in libGDX!

I haven’t written any test, nor implemented for iOS.  My test is an app I’m working on.. Will go to production in Sept to check out.

data.title: Fix error message in split pane. Fixes #3356.
data.body: See title.

data.title: [GWT] FileHandle.readBytes() doesn't work for internal
mipmap downscaling needs to do alpha weighting
data.body:
Here is what happens when you render a downscaled texture of a black antialiased circle against a black background in libgdx

![screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/btFCScA.png)

The color of the pixels around the edges of the image(fully transparent white) are being mixed with the not-entirely transparent pixels(black) on the alias of the circle. This can be avoided by using a blending function that weights the colors of transparent pixels by their alpha (so pixels you fully can't see wont interfere with your render)

Wolfire discuss it here blog.wolfire.com/2009/01/scaling-images-with-alpha/

There are other workarounds, but that seems like the most reasonable default behavior.

btw, here's precicely how I'm loading the image:

``` scala
def scalableTexture(fileName:String) = {
    val ret = new Texture(new FileHandle(fileName), true) //mipmapping on
    ret.setFilter(Texture.TextureFilter.MipMapLinearLinear, Texture.TextureFilter.MipMapLinearLinear)
    ret
}
```

data.title: TextField Alignment
data.body: It would seem there is no current way to set the text within a text field to be right-aligned. I've attempted `setAlignment` but it aligns the component, not the text.

data.title: SplitPane::setMaxSplitAmount Logic Error
data.body:
I might be reading this wrong, but it seems off to me:

> if (maxAmount > 1) throw new GdxRuntimeException("maxAmount has to be >= 0");

data.title: Improve behavior of Array#removeRange
data.body:
Array and friends use an inclusive range for the `removeRange` methods. I want to remove the first `n` elements of an array; what I currently have to do is this:

``` java
if (n > 0)
    array.removeRange(0, n - 1);
```

If it weren't from the `n > 0` check, I would get an `IndexOutOfBoundsException` saying `start can't be > end` for the case where `n` is `0`. This seems quite problematic API-wise.

I think it's better to have `end` exclusive, but that requires a nasty breaking change. An idea is to make `removeRange` do nothing for the case where `start > end`. The intention of this ticket is to remove the need of an if check on the caller side if feasible.

data.title: Added 2 methods and a line of class doc
data.body: Added addItem and removeItem methods and wrote a line on the List class documentation

data.title: Added VisRuntime extension
data.body: Added VisRuntime library to 3rd party extensions. This library is required to load projects exported from [VisEditor](https://github.com/kotcrab/VisEditor).

data.title: Implement parsing methods for vectors and rectangles
data.body: Implementation of parseXXX methods for `Vector2`, `Vector3` and `Rectangle`, as well as enhancements of `toString()` format. The format of `Vector2` is changed from `[x:y]` to `(x,y)`, `Vector3` is changed from `[x, y, z]` to `(x,y,z)`, and the format of `Rectangle` is changed from `x,y,w,h` to `[x,y,w,h]`. This was done for consistency and simplified parsing, and shouldn't break too much stuff.

data.title: XmlReader.java gets stuck in infinite loop on nVidia Android hardware due to ART optimizations
data.body:
The tight loops inside XmlReader.java end up being optimized by the ART on nVidia hardware - Shield TV and possibly others - such that changes to the loop variables are lost.

The problem occurs with the variables _upper and _lower in the while(true) loops at lines 130 and 152.

A workaround is to access those variables at the bottom of the loop in a debug log message between lines 141-142 and between 163-164.

data.title: GWT: utf-8 characters at the end of the buffer can be corrupted by BufferedReader
TilemapPacker doesnt work for some tilesets
data.body: TilemapPacker always crashes when you try to pack a tileset that is made from a collections of images instead of one tileset image. It crashes at line 274. Normally I would use a single tileset image but it annoying when you have lots of odd shaped tiles and even when you do it still doesn't work. (wrong tiles are rendered most of the time)
